intro: Oxydectes ciliatoglandulosa, commonly known as the hairy glandular daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant is notable for its hairy stems and leaves, which are covered in fine, glandular trichomes. Its flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oxydectes ciliatoglandulosa is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
